forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 62. South southwest wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 11am, then a chance of rain showers between 11am and 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 66 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn unfolds over Downtown San Francisco, the air hangs heavy with the whispers of rain, a reminder of the overnight showers that brushed past the city. The clouds, thick and contemplative, drape themselves softly against the skyline, offering a muted canvas that hints at the hidden beauty of the surroundings. The day ahead will dance between the possibility of gentle rain showers and breaks of sunshine, creating a symphony of shifting moods. Expect the temperature to fluctuate around a pleasant 68 degrees, softening into the afternoon as the breeze carries with it a touch of salt from the bay. 

For those venturing out, layering will be your ally. A light, breathable jacket paired with a comfortable shirt will shield you from brisk winds, while a good pair of shoes will make the day's discoveries even more enjoyable. With the prospect of rain lacing the morning, it might be a fine time to indulge in a warm cup of coffee at one of the local cafes, or perhaps take a leisurely stroll along the waterfront, where the gentle crash of waves harmonizes with the scent of damp earth and the promise of renewal. Embrace this serene interlude, where the city breathes deeply under cloudy skies, preparing for the sun to break through once again.
